definition: to offer a sacrifice to (gods or ancestors)/memorial ceremony/(in classical novels) to recite an incantation to activate a magic weapon/(lit. and fig.) to wield
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: The culture for King Zhou to worship is mainly characteristic of offering sacrifices to ancestors.
sentences.chinese: 周王祭礼文化独特特征是以祭祖为主。

sentences.english: Ceremonies were held on the summer solstice .
sentences.chinese: 每年夏至日出时行祭礼。

sentences.english: This is my last and final oblation.
sentences.chinese: 这是我最后且最终的祭礼。

sentences.english: Tell Him that, say it aloud and offer it as an offering.
sentences.chinese: 告诉他，大声地说出来，作为祭礼呈上。

sentences.english: The sacrificial rites in ancient China have a long history, and their contents are rich and colorful.
sentences.chinese: 中国古代祭礼，历史悠久，内容宏富，颇具特色。

definition: to offer sacrifices to the gods or ancestors
to offer sacrifices to one's ancestors
to offer a sacrifice to (gods or ancestors)/memorial ceremony/(in classical novels) to recite an incantation to activate a magic weapon/(lit. and fig.) to wield
the three sacrificial animals (originally cow, sheep and pig; later pig, chicken and fish)
to worship/to observe religious rites/to pay one's respects (to one's ancestors etc)
to offer thanks to the gods
to offer sacrifices to the gods
